intro: Billolivia truciae, commonly known as the Trucian billolivia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Trucia. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its flowers bloom in late spring and are pollinated primarily by nocturnal moths. Due to habitat loss, Billolivia truciae is classified as endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
